notes: YJ generation with distinctive rectangular headlights. Transfer case: New Process NP231. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep Wrangler (YJ) article, January 2025 revision.
TJ generation reintroduced round headlights. Available with rear-wheel drive or four-wheel drive configurations. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep Wrangler (TJ) article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 5.2L Chrysler Magnum V8 (318 CID, 225 hp, 300 lb-ft)
5.9L Chrysler Magnum V8 (360 CID, 245 hp, 345 lb-ft) - 1998 only
notes: ZJ generation offered multiple 4WD systems: Command-Trac (part-time, until 1996), Selec-Trac (full-time/part-time), and Quadra-Trac (permanent all-time). Trim levels included Base/SE, Laredo, Limited, Special Edition, TSi, Orvis Edition, and 5.9 Limited. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep Grand Cherokee (ZJ) article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 4.0L AMC Power-Tech I6 (242 CID, 195 hp @ 4600 rpm, 230 lb-ft @ 3000 rpm)
4.7L PowerTech V8 (287 CID, 235 hp @ 4800 rpm, 295 lb-ft @ 3200 rpm)
notes: WJ generation introduced in 1999 model year with improved refinement and new V8 engine option. Available in 2WD rear-wheel drive or 4WD configurations. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep Grand Cherokee (WJ) article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 4.0L I6 (242 CID, 190 hp @ 4,750 rpm) - 1991-1999 Chrysler MPI
notes: XJ generation compact SUV available throughout 1990s. 4WD models offered Command-Trac or Selec-Trac transfer cases. Fuel system transitioned from Renix MPI to Chrysler MPI in 1991. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep Cherokee (XJ) article, January 2025 revision.
